exo_book@bishop.name: exo_book
exo_book@bishop.examine:
It seems to be a how-to book on performing exorcisms.

After making the proper preparations, one has to EXORCISE [target] to
remove the horrid presence from their body.
exo_book@bishop.desc[0]: A book on exorcism has been left here.

vial1@bishop.name: vial1
vial1@bishop.examine: Flying is no hallucination once you are drunk.
vial1@bishop.desc[0]: A clear vial containing sparkling effervescence is here.

blessing@bishop.name: blessing
blessing@bishop.examine: It can definitely purify freshly made water.
blessing@bishop.desc[0]: A blessing from the heavens is here.

safe@bishop.desc[1]: A heavily dented safe squats here.
safe@bishop.desc[3]: A cracked and dented safe squats here.
safe@bishop.name: safe
safe@bishop.examine: Guaranteed protection from falls at great heights.
safe@bishop.desc[2]: A dented safe with one missing door hinge squats here.
safe@bishop.desc[0]: A heavy and thick-walled safe squats here.

pawn@bishop.desc[1]: A black chess pawn is here.
pawn@bishop.name: pawn
pawn@bishop.examine: Though equally worthless, black pawns are more annoying than white ones.
pawn@bishop.desc[0]: A white chess pawn is here.

scrap@bishop.name: scrap
scrap@bishop.examine: Perhaps the debris clinging to it could be cut away.
scrap@bishop.desc[0]: A scrap of white metal lies discarded here.

vapor@bishop.name: vapor
vapor@bishop.desc[0]: A large cloud of steam swirls gently.

hydrogen@bishop.name: hydrogen
hydrogen@bishop.examine:
Water is an element of life, but life will grow in a weedy circle
within the confines of the wetlands. Only can you light me there.
hydrogen@bishop.desc[0]: A bottle of free-floating hydrogen gas is here.

bible2@bishop.name: bible2
bible2@bishop.examine: The pink and red array of flowers on the cover shines bright in the sun.
bible2@bishop.desc[0]: A battered copy of the Korisla bible is here.

plaque@bishop.name: plaque
plaque@bishop.examine: Take thine mighty hands of doom and bash away!
plaque@bishop.desc[0]: An engraved plaque rests on the safe.

bishop@bishop.name: bishop
bishop@bishop.examine:
Two things of note to whoever accepts this figurine and the responsibility
that goes with it...
1) Monks are not very trusting. You will have to seek the proof shown by
   the mouths of sacred animals at the gates of the monastery.
2) At the altar put relics three, then this figurine of me.
- Monsignour Crabapple
bishop@bishop.desc[0]: A chess bishop carved of white marble is here.

paint@bishop.name: paint
paint@bishop.examine: Dyes R Us: Reliable coats for 40 years!
paint@bishop.desc[0]: A wooden bucket of black paint stands here.

sign@bishop.name: sign
sign@bishop.examine:
Some pieces of advice:
1> If you get totally stuck and want to leave the zone without finishing the
   quest, feel free to eat the cheesecake found in here. The vial and cake
   will be set back to their starts to allow multiple entrances. The quest is
   still designed for a single person, though.
2> Remember, you may need to act like a priest, but do not abuse your
   exorcising power.
      -- Some unlucky schumck
sign@bishop.desc[0]: A small sign is posted here.

cake@bishop.name: cake
cake@bishop.desc[0]: A slab of cheesecake is here.

flagon@bishop.name: flagon
flagon@bishop.examine: The liquid inside totally reeks of its alcoholic contents.
flagon@bishop.desc[0]: A flagon half-full of sasparilla lays here.

vial2@bishop.name: vial2
vial2@bishop.examine: Flying will be no hallucination if you partake of me.
vial2@bishop.desc[0]: A clear vial containing a deep blue liquid is here.

safekey@bishop.name: safekey
safekey@bishop.examine: It will only fit one lock.
safekey@bishop.desc[0]: A thick silver safekey lies here.

stake@bishop.name: stake
stake@bishop.examine: This could tartare someone who tartares the innocent.
stake@bishop.desc[0]: A sharply pointed fence stake has been left here.

bible3@bishop.name: bible3
bible3@bishop.examine: The leaves capture the sunlight and convert it into food for the pages.
bible3@bishop.desc[0]: A battered copy of the Korisla bible is here.

rake@bishop.name: rake
rake@bishop.examine:
The caretaker obviously didn't part with this happily, as denoted by the 
blood stains on it.
rake@bishop.desc[0]: A sturdy metal rake has been left here.

calcite@bishop.desc[1]: A chunk of calcite has broken off a tunnel wall.
calcite@bishop.name: calcite
calcite@bishop.examine: An elf would find this very valuable, but elves don't exist here.
calcite@bishop.desc[0]: A calcite clod awaits a new master here.

doll@bishop.name: doll
doll@bishop.desc[0]: A child's doll with a stitched smile and a missing nose is here.

water@bishop.desc[1]: A consecrated aquaglobe of water glistens with potent magical energy here.
water@bishop.name: water
water@bishop.desc[0]: A magical aquaglobe of water spins and sparkles through with sunlight.

cross@bishop.name: cross
cross@bishop.examine: Looks like a repair shop could help this thing.

bible1@bishop.name: bible1
bible1@bishop.examine: The fine and gnarly roots on the cover have perfectly matching earth tones.
bible1@bishop.desc[0]: A battered copy of the Korisla bible is here.

board@bishop.name: board
board@bishop.examine: The game appears to be missing a black pawn.
board@bishop.desc[0]: A metallic chessboard with equally metallic pieces is here.

altar@bishop.name: altar
altar@bishop.examine:
Scrawled into the side of the altar is a plea for help from the bishops 
of this monastery. The Archbishop has been taken control of by a 
malevolent force and has defiled this temple by scattering the relics 
across the land. If they are returned to thier sacred places upon this
altar, then a bishop figurine on the altar will allow one to confront the
turncoat Archbishop.
altar@bishop.desc[0]: A marble altar devoted to the immortal rulers of Korisla sits here.

note@bishop.name: note
note@bishop.examine: Seek ye the holy book bound in the natural process of photosynthesis.
note@bishop.desc[0]: A note inscribed on an edible leaf is here.

bishop30@bishop.title: Garden Alcove
bishop30@bishop.description:
This is where the monks gather to pray on a daily basis. The wide 
semicircle of the alcove allows them to pay homage to a minor deity, the 
one which supports life in this area of the world. There is a marble 
altar as the centerpiece of this arrangement of stone pews with three 
indentations in it. However, the monastery's religious artifacts are not 
present here. Normally, the Archbishop of the monks would be here 
himself to protect to artifacts, but the bishop has gone missing for 
days now.

bishop16@bishop.title: Bedroom
bishop16@bishop.description:
This is the private chamber of the caretaker, where his dreams take 
place and start the process into real life. A full-length mirror is in 
one corner, and a small dresser stands next to the bed. Stairs lead 
down, while a doorway is to the north.

bishop7@bishop.title: Vortex
bishop7@bishop.description: Learn to follow directions when all horizons look the same.

bishop23@bishop.title: Monastery Gates
bishop23@bishop.description:
The western archway of the Korisla Monastery has a three-headed dragon 
with a bible in its mouth perched between the twin pairs of brick 
turrets. Long wicker torches freshly dipped in pitch and dried are set 
ready to provide an eternal firelight when the last traces of evil are 
purged from the land. Perimeter guards from the more war-chivalrous 
caste of the monastery are stationed in each turret to keep the order 
and tranquillity both within and without. Beyond the gatehouse is a 
garden on the inside and a plethora of open acreage on the outside.

bishop33@bishop.title: Horizon Expanse Pathway
bishop33@bishop.description:
The fertile and rolling plains are broken by sporadic patches of 
thorny briars and seven foot tall thistles. The road becomes pitted with 
rocks and holes, turning the terrain into a weed-consumed landscape. 
Dead tangles of ivy and poison oak grow in increasing quantities, their 
long, brown-leafed vines winding around a pair of rusty iron gates to 
the east.

bishop56@bishop.title: &+RChamber of the Damned
bishop56@bishop.description: This particular void holds the bishop zone junk until needed!

bishop42@bishop.title: Western Crypt
bishop42@bishop.description:
The body of a high druid priest was incarcerated here nearly 500 years 
ago. His mummified remains occupy an engraved sarcophagus set atop a 
marble pedestal in the pit of the crypt. The air is fresh as the crypt 
was broken open and plundered many years back, but equally fresh rodent 
and snake droppings confirm that there are still visitors here.

bishop34@bishop.title: Cemetery Gates
bishop34@bishop.description:
Creaking and squeaking in the voluminous amount of wind which whips 
across the cemetery barrier, a spiked iron gate with central hump spans 
the distance between two cracked and chipped pillars of weathered stone. 
A rusted and broken lock on an equally rusty chain once held the two 
halves of the gate together. Above this lock is fashioned the likeness 
of a scaly, one-eyed lizard, its extended tongue letting loose 
flickering green lightning. These high-voltage bolt of electricity shoot 
diagonally upwards to the top of the pillars, where it is absorbed by 
metal balls which glow weakly with each influx of energy. At the base of 
the gate, not daring to venture into the unyielding goodness of the 
prairie, is a foot-thick layer of violently swirling gray fog.

bishop51@bishop.title: Korisla Bog
bishop51@bishop.description:
The marsh grows much wetter here, where every footstep squishes in two 
inches of mud. The 'firm ground' consists of small mounds of stinking 
mire, located admist two-foot deep trenches of water. Vile methane swamp 
gas hisses forth from subterranean geysers of bubbling muck, and swamp 
mosquitoes buzz angrily around these explosions. Snakes and a few 
spiders are also resident here to breed within the warmth of the 
geysers. As the many trenches of the river converge into a pool, the 
ground suddenly drops into a pit, and no living thing has ever escaped 
from these quicksand-like holes. Vegetation is limited to tufts of 
sickly brown grass and decaying weeds. On a nearby hill of sludge, those 
tufts are arranged sporadically in a rhombus.

bishop45@bishop.title: Horizon Expanse Trail
bishop45@bishop.description:
Long, tall, thin grasses grow everywhere in this prairie, blowing in 
the cross winds and shedding their pollen to the skies. Crickets chirp 
from deep within the grass, forever only to be heard. Among the grasses 
are also various types of grain. The wild herds of oxen and cows which 
roam these plains live in utter bliss with the sheer amount of food 
present around them. Spread throughout the prairie are patches set aside 
by nature for extremely tall sunflowers. These circles of petals around 
a darker core grow in unconcealed delight as they process the natural 
radiation tossed down at them.

bishop43@bishop.title: Monastery Gates
bishop43@bishop.description:
The southern archway of the Korisla Monastery has a prehistoric lion 
with a potion of holy water in its mouth perched between the twin pairs 
of brick turrets. Long wicker torches freshly dipped in pitch and dried 
are set ready to provide an eternal firelight when the last traces of 
evil are purged from the land. Perimeter guards from the more 
war-chivalrous caste of the monastery are stationed in each turret to 
keep the order and tranquillity both within and without. Beyond the 
gatehouse is a garden on the inside and a plethora of open acreage on 
the outside.

bishop18@bishop.title: Back Room
bishop18@bishop.description:
The kitchen and dining area is well-equipped with provisions, enough 
to feed an army and provide a taxidermist with a well-stuffed 
individual. Some cookware and ladles hang from wall hooks around a 
central stove, which is connected directly to the ceiling. A long, black 
pipe channels the smoke and steam of frying meals and boiling water to 
the sky. A book of recipes stands on a podium for making extravagant and 
gourmet dishes. In one corner lays the open trapdoor to a cellar.

bishop47@bishop.title: Marshlands
bishop47@bishop.description:
Tall reeds and algae are the main forms of vegetation here, the latter 
surrounding islands built out of the former. Dry land is not always easy 
to find, but neither is the network of river water very deep. The ground 
is remarkably flat and allows no shelter from the cross winds that blow 
in from the east. Crawdads and skitter bugs swim the stretches of dark 
blue between their spawning nests and favorite places to gather food. 
Some parts of the river break off into slowly stirring eddies and pull 
in bits of plant and dirt.

bishop4@bishop.title: Tunnel Slope
bishop4@bishop.description:
The ground here is more treacherous on a hillside as it is now. Water 
flows in small streams at high speed down the slope, washing away the 
loose gravel and depositing calcium compounds. As a result, the ground 
loses considerable traction, and movement can only be made safe by a 
tricky dance of zigzagging and sidestepping.

bishop2@bishop.title: Tunnel Passage
bishop2@bishop.description:
A hand-carved passage wide enough for three people walking abreast runs  
east and west here. The stony walls are composed of nearly pure limestone, 
with the few other trace components giving off an eerie blue glow and an 
occasional flash of green lightning as an unnatural source of underground 
electricity travels through them. Along the floor by these sides, a line 
of spiders moves steadily away from the east exit, where the ground begins 
to slope upward. At various spots along the tunnel, a rocky crag will jut
out and partially block the passageway like a person with a mild degree 
of arteriosclerosis. Water from underground springs and pools drains 
into this place and gradually eats away at the crags. This passage is 
still new, for there are no signs yet of the formation of stalactites or 
stalagmites.

bishop52@bishop.title: Korisla Bog
bishop52@bishop.description:
The marsh grows much wetter here, where every footstep squishes in two 
inches of mud. The 'firm ground' consists of small mounds of stinking 
mire, located admist two-foot deep trenches of water. Vile methane swamp 
gas hisses forth from subterranean geysers of bubbling muck, and swamp 
mosquitoes buzz angrily around these explosions. Snakes and a few 
spiders are also resident here to breed within the warmth of the 
geysers. As the many trenches of the river converge into a pool, the 
ground suddenly drops into a pit, and no living thing has ever escaped 
from these quicksand-like holes. Vegetation is limited to tufts of 
sickly brown grass and decaying weeds. On a nearby hill of sludge, an 
unusal tropical array of flowers are arranged sporadically in a circle.

bishop55@bishop.title: Korisla Bog
bishop55@bishop.description:
The marsh grows much wetter here, where every footstep squishes in two 
inches of mud. The 'firm ground' consists of small mounds of stinking 
mire, located admist two-foot deep trenches of water. Vile methane swamp 
gas hisses forth from subterranean geysers of bubbling muck, and swamp 
mosquitoes buzz angrily around these explosions. Snakes and a few 
spiders are also resident here to breed within the warmth of the 
geysers. As the many trenches of the river converge into a pool, the 
ground suddenly drops into a pit, and no living thing has ever escaped 
from these quicksand-like holes. Vegetation is limited to tufts of 
sickly brown grass and decaying weeds. On a nearby hill of sludge, those 
tufts are arranged sporadically in a rhombus.

bishop48@bishop.title: Marshlands
bishop48@bishop.description:
Tall reeds and algae are the main forms of vegetation here, the latter 
surrounding islands built out of the former. Dry land is not always easy 
to find, but neither is the network of river water very deep. The ground 
is remarkably flat and allows no shelter from the cross winds that blow 
in from the east. Crawdads and skitter bugs swim the stretches of dark 
blue between their spawning nests and favorite places to gather food. 
Some parts of the river break off into slowly stirring eddies and pull 
in bits of plant and dirt.

bishop46@bishop.title: Muddy Trail
bishop46@bishop.description:
The southern edge of the prairie borders on a wide river going through 
the plains and marks the boundary between dry fields and marshlands. 
This section of the trail is a muddy mixture of dirt and clay. 
Footprints and pawprints give evidence of the small cats, rodents, and 
marsupials who roam this land.

bishop10@bishop.title: Circle of Cropped Grass
bishop10@bishop.description:
A nearly perfect circle of cropped grass stands here in a remote area 
of this prairie. Eleven steel chairs stand in a ring around the outer 
edge, and on these chairs are bolted ankle, wrist, and neck shackles. In 
front of each chair is a solid iron cup stained raspberry red from the 
blood of human sacrifices performed here. There are no people currently 
here, but small rivers of blood flow from the cups to a block of 
hardened steel in the center of this circle. Eleven piles of bones 
brittle with age and parched from the elements lay heaped individually, 
where the are placed in such a way as to ward off visitors. The blood 
trails follow up from the sides of this sacrilegious altar and are drunk 
by the open mouths of the sightless skulls.

bishop37@bishop.title: Druid Cemetery
bishop37@bishop.description:
A broken and leaf-littered pathway of dried, cracked earth wends its 
way among a maze of crumbling tombstones and moldy ground. Damp moss 
hangs in tatters from bare, rotting, bug-infested tree branches and 
periodically drops to be swallowed by the fog layer. Few are the musical 
tones generated by crickets when the cackling howls of banshees ride the 
wind. Due to a perpetual cloud of evil black smoke, the cemetery is kept 
in shrouded darkness. Green lightning pass through this cloak in sheets, 
flashing momentarily and letting the dozens of gore-stained poles 
staggered throughout the graveyard shine in dismal glory. The poles 
contain the bodies of Korisla monks slain in a decisive war, where each 
victim has been magically reanimated, impaled once, then folded over 
backwards and impaled again, forming human shish-ka-bobs.

bishop11@bishop.title: Horizon Expanse
bishop11@bishop.description:
Long, tall, thin grasses grow everywhere in this prairie, blowing in 
the cross winds and shedding their pollen to the skies. Crickets chirp 
from deep within the grass, forever only to be heard. Among the grasses 
are also various types of grain. The wild herds of oxen and cows which 
roam these plains live in utter bliss with the sheer amount of food 
present around them. Spread throughout the prairie are patches set aside 
by nature for extremely tall sunflowers. These circles of petals around 
a darker core grow in unconcealed delight as they process the natural 
radiation tossed down at them.

bishop19@bishop.title: Stocked Cellar
bishop19@bishop.description:
The dry goods of the house seem to manage themselves well in this dark 
shelter. Wooden shelves with metal rivets line the boarded walls and 
struts in here, supporting the many raw ingredients, salts, and spices 
used by the caretaker. A large oaken door with elaborate cross-braces 
lies open, and light filters in from the upstairs trapdoor.

bishop50@bishop.title: Korisla Bog
bishop50@bishop.description:
The marsh grows much wetter here, where every footstep squishes in two 
inches of mud. The 'firm ground' consists of small mounds of stinking 
mire, located admist two-foot deep trenches of water. Vile methane swamp 
gas hisses forth from subterranean geysers of bubbling muck, and swamp 
mosquitoes buzz angrily around these explosions. Snakes and a few 
spiders are also resident here to breed within the warmth of the 
geysers. As the many trenches of the river converge into a pool, the 
ground suddenly drops into a pit, and no living thing has ever escaped 
from these quicksand-like holes. Vegetation is limited to tufts of 
sickly brown grass and decaying weeds. On a nearby hill of sludge, those 
tufts are arranged sporadically in a rhombus.

bishop44@bishop.title: Horizon Expanse Trail
bishop44@bishop.description:
Long, tall, thin grasses grow everywhere in this prairie, blowing in 
the cross winds and shedding their pollen to the skies. Crickets chirp 
from deep within the grass, forever only to be heard. Among the grasses 
are also various types of grain. The wild herds of oxen and cows which 
roam these plains live in utter bliss with the sheer amount of food 
present around them. Spread throughout the prairie are patches set aside 
by nature for extremely tall sunflowers. These circles of petals around 
a darker core grow in unconcealed delight as they process the natural 
radiation tossed down at them.

bishop6@bishop.title: Vortex
bishop6@bishop.description:
Fierce winds pull at your clothes and hair as the vortex slowly whirls 
you around in circles. Lines of bright light emanate from various 
points, streaking past like sun rays or lasers, but none contain enough 
power to be threatening. One exit of this portal is to the west, leading 
to a dark tunnel, and the lines of light squiggle in arrow formations 
vectoring generally east and west.

bishop40@bishop.title: Middle Crypt
bishop40@bishop.description:
The body of a high druid priest was incarcerated here nearly 500 years 
ago. His mummified remains occupy an engraved sarcophagus set atop a 
marble pedestal in the pit of the crypt. The air is fresh as the crypt 
was broken open and plundered many years back, but equally fresh rodent 
and snake droppings confirm that there are still visitors here.

bishop32@bishop.title: Horizon Expanse Pathway
bishop32@bishop.description:
Long, tall, thin grasses grow everywhere in this prairie, blowing in 
the cross winds and shedding their pollen to the skies. Crickets chirp 
from deep within the grass, forever only to be heard. Among the grasses 
are also various types of grain. The wild herds of oxen and cows which 
roam these plains live in utter bliss with the sheer amount of food 
present around them. Spread throughout the prairie are patches set aside 
by nature for extremely tall sunflowers. These circles of petals around
a darker core grow in unconcealed delight as they process the natural 
radiation tossed down at them. The raked roadway continues to the west 
and east. Here the roadway is unkempt, and the eastern skyline is as 
black as night.

bishop41@bishop.title: Druid Cemetery
bishop41@bishop.description:
A broken and leaf-littered pathway of dried, cracked earth wends its 
way among a maze of crumbling tombstones and moldy ground. Damp moss 
hangs in tatters from bare, rotting, bug-infested tree branches and 
periodically drops to be swallowed by the fog layer. Few are the musical 
tones generated by crickets when the cackling howls of banshees ride the 
wind. Due to a perpetual cloud of evil black smoke, the cemetery is kept 
in shrouded darkness. Green lightning pass through this cloak in sheets, 
flashing momentarily and letting the dozens of gore-stained poles 
staggered throughout the graveyard shine in dismal glory. The poles 
contain the bodies of Korisla monks slain in a decisive war, where each 
victim has been magically reanimated, impaled once, then folded over 
backwards and impaled again, forming human shish-ka-bobs.

bishop36@bishop.title: Cemetery Shop
bishop36@bishop.description:
This ramshackle shed was once the place where the tenders of the dark 
cemetery repaired their caskets, coffins, and tombstones. Other 
artifacts had been brought in to be fixed or detailed, but now lay in 
discarded piles of rusting garbage.

bishop15@bishop.title: Front Room
bishop15@bishop.description:
The spirit of 'home sweet home' and nostalgia are ever-present in 
here. On a brick fireplace mantle lay the small heirlooms of the dirt 
road's caretaker - a whittled duck, a brass pair of night goggles, an 
engraved necklace, and a leather coat-of-arms. Two rocking chairs, a 
small desk, and a well-sanded desk, all made of wood, represent the main 
complement of furniture.

bishop25@bishop.title: Crossways
bishop25@bishop.description:
The two main roads of the garden intersect here. The garden surrounds 
everywhere except to the north, where the monastery place of worship 
sits in a sheltered alcove.

bishop27@bishop.title: Korisla Gardens
bishop27@bishop.description:
Bugs have feasted on some of the gigantic ferns present in here. 
Winged insects hop from flower to flower, attracted by the petal color and 
scent of nectar. The monks have grown this garden from seedlings and lay 
down fresh dirt and mulch every spring. Pruning takes place in the fall 
to allow the cycle of growth and rebirth to remain unbroken. Water is 
fed from tens of small, elegantly carved fountains in the shape of bison 
and dolphins. Paths lead in all directions from here, giving access to 
private nooks within the leafy garden. Where one of the perimeter walls 
stands, clumps of well-tended ivy provide a sense of background and 
completion to the garden as well as a quick means of scaling the wall in 
the monastery is attacked.

bishop54@bishop.title: Marshlands
bishop54@bishop.description:
Tall reeds and algae are the main forms of vegetation here, the latter 
surrounding islands built out of the former. Dry land is not always easy 
to find, but neither is the network of river water very deep. The ground 
is remarkably flat and allows no shelter from the cross winds that blow 
in from the east. Crawdads and skitter bugs swim the stretches of dark 
blue between their spawning nests and favorite places to gather food. 
Some parts of the river break off into slowly stirring eddies and pull 
in bits of plant and dirt.

bishop12@bishop.title: Three-Way Intersection
bishop12@bishop.description:
A wide dirt road leads along two of the cardinal directions. Small 
rocks line the road to prevent unwanted takeovers by the surrounding 
grassy prairie. It is kept in seemingly good condition, as there are 
fresh rake marks within the road. Dustdevils, footprints, and wagons 
tend to leave the caretaker forever raking.

bishop26@bishop.title: Korisla Gardens
bishop26@bishop.description:
Bugs have feasted on some of the gigantic ferns present in here. 
Winged insects hop from flower to flower, attracted by the petal color 
and scent of nectar. The monks have grown this garden from seedlings and 
lay down fresh dirt and mulch every spring. Pruning takes place in the 
fall to allow the cycle of growth and rebirth to remain unbroken. Water 
is fed from tens of small, elegantly carved fountains in the shape of 
bison and dolphins. Paths lead in all directions from here, giving 
access to private nooks within the leafy garden. Where one of the 
perimeter walls stands, clumps of well-tended ivy provide a sense of 
background and completion to the garden as well as a quick means of 
scaling the wall in the monastery is attacked.

bishop20@bishop.title: Wine Cellar
bishop20@bishop.description:
Vintages of many kinds of spirits, mainly comprised of the popular 
brands of ale, brandy, and heavy sasprilla. Green, brown, and black 
bottles are laid carefully on the wire racks to avoid breakage and 
confusion when choosing an ideal drink for a given setting.

bishop24@bishop.title: Korisla Gardens
bishop24@bishop.description:
Bugs have feasted on some of the gigantic ferns present in here. 
Winged insects hop from flower to flower, attracted by the petal color 
and scent of nectar. The monks have grown this garden from seedlings and 
lay down fresh dirt and mulch every spring. Pruning takes place in the 
fall to allow the cycle of growth and rebirth to remain unbroken. Water 
is fed from tens of small, elegantly carved fountains in the shape of 
bison and dolphins. Paths lead in all directions from here, giving 
access to private nooks within the leafy garden. Where one of the 
perimeter walls stands, clumps of well-tended ivy provide a sense of 
background and completion to the garden as well as a quick means of 
scaling the wall in the monastery is attacked.

bishop14@bishop.title: Front Porch
bishop14@bishop.description:
A set of stairs lead up to a rickety wooden porch. A wall cover of ivy 
drapes the supports of the house, and potted plants line the far side, 
their leaves sprawled to receive the sunlight. Stained-glass windows 
fill in their squarish panes, and a circle of branded designs encompass 
the doorway.

bishop39@bishop.title: Circle of Gravestones
bishop39@bishop.description:
A raised ring of graves is set in a clearing here, perfectly spaced 
from each other and having the same length. In the center of this circle 
stands a small plinth made of oozing blood. The flow of this liquid of 
life is kept going by a dark blue fireball on the top of the plinth, 
which shoots out random arcs of green lightning. Surrounding the 
tombstone perimeter of the circles are offering bowls jammed with 
platinum coins and pearl amulets, their lustrous qualities having long 
since degraded.

bishop1@bishop.title: Tunnel Passage
bishop1@bishop.description:
A hand-carved passage wide enough for three people walking abreast 
runs east and west here. The stony walls are composed of nearly pure limestone,
with the few other trace components giving off an eerie blue glow and an
occasional flash of green lightning as an unnatural source of underground
electricity travels through them. Along the floor by these sides, a line
of spiders moves steadily away from the east exit, where  the ground
begins to slope upward. At various spots along the tunnel, a rocky crag
will jut out and partially block the passageway like a person with a mild
degree of arteriosclerosis. Water from underground springs and pools
drains into this place and gradually eats away at the crags. This passage
is still new, for there are no signs yet of the formation of stalactites
or stalagmites.

bishop13@bishop.title: Northern Road
bishop13@bishop.description:
Long, tall, thin grasses grow everywhere in this prairie, blowing in 
the cross winds and shedding their pollen to the skies. Crickets chirp 
from deep within the grass, forever only to be heard. Among the grasses 
are also various types of grain. The wild herds of oxen and cows which 
roam these plains live in utter bliss with the sheer amount of food 
present around them. Spread throughout the prairie are patches set aside 
by nature for extremely tall sunflowers. These circles of petals around 
a darker core grow in unconcealed delight as they process the natural 
radiation tossed down at them. The fine dirt road leads south deeper 
into the prairie and north to a cottage.

bishop21@bishop.title: Horizon Expanse Pathway
bishop21@bishop.description:
Long, tall, thin grasses grow everywhere in this prairie, blowing in 
the cross winds and shedding their pollen to the skies. Crickets chirp 
from deep within the grass, forever only to be heard. Among the grasses 
are also various types of grain. The wild herds of oxen and cows which 
roam these plains live in utter bliss with the sheer amount of food 
present around them. Spread throughout the prairie are patches set aside 
by nature for extremely tall sunflowers. These circles of petals around 
a darker core grow in unconcealed delight as they process the natural 
radiation tossed down at them. The raked roadway continues to the west 
and east.

bishop8@bishop.title: Vortex
bishop8@bishop.description:
Fierce winds pull at your clothes and hair as the vortex slowly whirls 
you around in circles. Lines of bright light emanate from various 
points, streaking past like sun rays or lasers, but none contain enough 
power to be threatening. Suddenly, the background drops away to reveal 
only a single, supportive, rotating disc for the vortex travelers. The 
wind also dies out, exposing the full nature of this unnatural emptiness.

bishop28@bishop.title: Korisla Gardens
bishop28@bishop.description:
Bugs have feasted on some of the gigantic ferns present in here. 
Winged insects hop from flower to flower, attracted by the petal color 
and scent of nectar. The monks have grown this garden from seedlings and 
lay down fresh dirt and mulch every spring. Pruning takes place in the 
fall to allow the cycle of growth and rebirth to remain unbroken. Water 
is fed from tens of small, elegantly carved fountains in the shape of 
bison and dolphins. Paths lead in all directions from here, giving 
access to private nooks within the leafy garden. Where one of the 
perimeter walls stands, clumps of well-tended ivy provide a sense of 
background and completion to the garden as well as a quick means of 
scaling the wall in the monastery is attacked.

bishop35@bishop.title: Druid Cemetery
bishop35@bishop.description:
A broken and leaf-littered pathway of dried, cracked earth wends its 
way among a maze of crumbling tombstones and moldy ground. Damp moss 
hangs in tatters from bare, rotting, bug-infested tree branches and 
periodically drops to be swallowed by the fog layer. Few are the musical 
tones generated by crickets when the cackling howls of banshees ride the 
wind. Due to a perpetual cloud of evil black smoke, the cemetery is kept 
in shrouded darkness. Green lightning pass through this cloak in sheets, 
flashing momentarily and letting the dozens of gore-stained poles 
staggered throughout the graveyard shine in dismal glory. The poles 
contain the bodies of Korisla monks slain in a decisive war, where each 
victim has been magically reanimated, impaled once, then folded over 
backwards and impaled again, forming human shish-ka-bobs.

bishop9@bishop.title: Bird's-Eye View
bishop9@bishop.description:
Clouds hang motionless in the bright blue sky which surrounds the 
travelers disc. Also present among the softly-hued atmosphere are dark 
green organic bodies from which long tentacles droop. When a native bird 
or stray air current containing particles of plant matter brushes 
against these tendrils, the agile limbs waste no time in capturing and 
paralyzing. The bodies float on the air currents and vary enough in 
altitude to allow safe passage down to a flat land scape.

bishop53@bishop.title: Korisla Bog
bishop53@bishop.description:
The marsh grows much wetter here, where every footstep squishes in two 
inches of mud. The 'firm ground' consists of small mounds of stinking 
mire, located admist two-foot deep trenches of water. Vile methane swamp 
gas hisses forth from subterranean geysers of bubbling muck, and swamp 
mosquitoes buzz angrily around these explosions. Snakes and a few 
spiders are also resident here to breed within the warmth of the 
geysers. As the many trenches of the river converge into a pool, the 
ground suddenly drops into a pit, and no living thing has ever escaped 
from these quicksand-like holes. Vegetation is limited to tufts of 
sickly brown grass and decaying weeds. On a nearby hill of sludge, those 
tufts are arranged sporadically in a rhombus.

bishop31@bishop.title: Monastery Gates
bishop31@bishop.description:
The eastern archway of the Korisla Monastery has a two-headed sea 
serpent with a glowing cross in its mouth perched between the twin 
pairs of brick turrets. Long wicker torches freshly dipped in pitch and 
dried are set ready to provide an eternal firelight when the last traces 
of evil are purged from the land. Perimeter guards from the more 
war-chivalrous caste of the monastery are stationed in each turret to 
keep the order and tranquillity both within and without. Beyond the 
gatehouse is a garden on the inside and a plethora of open acreage on 
the outside.

bishop5@bishop.title: Tunnel Slope
bishop5@bishop.description:
The ground slopes sharply downward here, pouring the running water 
almost in the style of a waterfall. The lightning on the walls flickers 
madly as some of it is routed through the trickling rivers. Spots of 
underground moss and lichen grow here, striped with earth tones and 
glowing weakly whenever a pulse of electricity reaches them. To the 
downside, the tunnel is virtually black despite the vegetation and 
lightning. From the east a swirling vortex sucks remote, trace amounts 
of dust into its core and tugs at the lichen.

bishop49@bishop.title: Korisla Bog
bishop49@bishop.description:
The marsh grows much wetter here, where every footstep squishes in two 
inches of mud. The 'firm ground' consists of small mounds of stinking 
mire, located admist two-foot deep trenches of water. Vile methane swamp 
gas hisses forth from subterranean geysers of bubbling muck, and swamp 
mosquitoes buzz angrily around these explosions. Snakes and a few 
spiders are also resident here to breed within the warmth of the 
geysers. As the many trenches of the river converge into a pool, the 
ground suddenly drops into a pit, and no living thing has ever escaped 
from these quicksand-like holes. Vegetation is limited to tufts of 
sickly brown grass and decaying weeds. On a nearby hill of sludge, those 
tufts are arranged sporadically in a rhombus.

bishop17@bishop.title: Attic Space
bishop17@bishop.description:
Not many shafts of sunlight penetrate the only window in this 
junk-filled room - a few, small slats in a wooden circle. A footlocker 
of an approximate 45 years of age lies open to reveal old military 
dispatches, letters from long-gone people and their sweethearts, and 
collectibles from faraway nations. Quilted pillow and embroidered linens 
are wrapped in protective tarps and stacked neatly to one side of the 
window. The air is slightly musty, but surprisingly dust free, as if the 
room was swept on a daily basis.

bishop3@bishop.title: Tunnel Slope
bishop3@bishop.description:
The ground here is more treacherous on a hillside as it is now. Water 
flows in small streams at high speed down the slope, washing away the 
loose gravel and depositing calcium compounds. As a result, the ground 
loses considerable traction, and movement can only be made safe by a 
tricky dance of zigzagging and sidestepping.

bishop38@bishop.title: Eastern Crypt
bishop38@bishop.description:
The body of a high druid priest was incarcerated here nearly 500 years 
ago. His mummified remains occupy an engraved sarcophagus set atop a 
marble pedestal in the pit of the crypt. The air is fresh as the crypt 
was broken open and plundered many years back, but equally fresh rodent 
and snake droppings confirm that there are still visitors here.

bishop22@bishop.title: Horizon Expanse Pathway
bishop22@bishop.description:
Long, tall, thin grasses grow everywhere in this prairie, blowing in 
the cross winds and shedding their pollen to the skies. Crickets chirp 
from deep within the grass, forever only to be heard. Among the grasses 
are also various types of grain. The wild herds of oxen and cows which 
roam these plains live in utter bliss with the sheer amount of food 
present around them. Spread throughout the prairie are patches set aside 
by nature for extremely tall sunflowers. These circles of petals around 
a darker core grow in unconcealed delight as they process the natural 
radiation tossed down at them. The raked roadway continues to the west 
and east.

bishop29@bishop.title: Korisla Gardens
bishop29@bishop.description:
Bugs have feasted on some of the gigantic ferns present in here. 
Winged insects hop from flower to flower, attracted by the petal color 
and scent of nectar. The monks have grown this garden from seedlings and 
lay down fresh dirt and mulch every spring. Pruning takes place in the 
fall to allow the cycle of growth and rebirth to remain unbroken. Water 
is fed from tens of small, elegantly carved fountains in the shape of 
bison and dolphins. Paths lead in all directions from here, giving
access to private nooks within the leafy garden. Where one of the
perimeter walls stands, clumps of well-tended icy provide a sense of
background and completion to the garden as well as a quick means of
scaling the wall if the monastery is attacked.

body@bishop.name: body
body@bishop.description:
The possessed Archbishop waves his ankhed staff in preparation to 
decapitate you.

corpse2@bishop.name: corpse2
corpse2@bishop.description: A corpse skulks in the shadows.

corpse3@bishop.name: corpse3
corpse3@bishop.description: The smell of a corpse lingers in the air.

mosquito@bishop.name: mosquito
mosquito@bishop.description: A hovering mosquito divebombs at a pulsing artery.

corpse1@bishop.name: corpse1
corpse1@bishop.description: A corpse launches itself at you!

spirit@bishop.name: spirit
spirit@bishop.examine: One mistake with me and you will forfeit your immortal soul!
spirit@bishop.description: A damned soul draws small bits of debris into its whirling core.

monk2@bishop.name: monk2
monk2@bishop.description: One of the armor-clad brothers, Grizzdel, of the monastery is here.

crabapple@bishop.name: crabapple
crabapple@bishop.description: The head of domestic affairs, Crabapple, drinks to his demise.

vampire@bishop.name: vampire
vampire@bishop.examine:
This particular member of the undead struts around silently, proudly, and
gracefully. His dark black hair is pulled back in an elegant pony tail,
and mother-of-pearl cufflings are ruffled perfectly on his shirt sleeves.
A crisp boutinerre rises from the left lapel of his immaculet jacket.

A well-cooked stake could make a nice tartare out of this guy.
vampire@bishop.description: A vampire dressed to the hilt ponders where to get his next meal.

ghoul@bishop.name: ghoul
ghoul@bishop.description: The master mechanic, Handyghoul, mutters something about its stolen tool set.

monk3@bishop.name: monk3
monk3@bishop.description: One of the armor-clad brothers, Illkoy, of the monastery is here.

fatrat@bishop.name: fatrat
fatrat@bishop.description: Fatrat squeaks in delight as he waddles through the plains.

fred@bishop.name: fred
fred@bishop.description: Fred is the head honcho of this house, and he is ordering you out!

packrat@bishop.name: packrat
packrat@bishop.description: A hulking packrat of the marshland is here.

monk1@bishop.name: monk1
monk1@bishop.description: One of the armor-clad brothers, Jon, of the monastery is here.

gator@bishop.name: gator
gator@bishop.description: There is a red-scaled gator walking about.
